p: The age of the cases varied from 2 years to 74 years (mean 21.6 ± 1.03). The adolescents and young adults (10–29 years) were most commonly affected. Overall, attack rate was 27.1/10000 and age specific attack rate was the highest between 10 and 14 years age group (86.7/10000), males were affected more than females (64% versus 36%, Chi-square: 6.80, P < 0.05). The gender-specific attack rate was higher among males (32.8/10000 male population) as compared to females (20.8/10,000 females) Table 1.
